title: Travel Across Europe, One Easy Trip at a Time
subtitle: Find simple, realistic ideas for city breaks, longer routes and relaxed European trips.
body:
TravelAcross EU is a practical guide to exploring Europe without the stress. We focus on real routes, walkable city breaks and simple ways to combine trains, flights and local transport.

Start by choosing a country or a city, then explore suggested areas, neighborhoods and trip ideas that match how you actually like to travel.

New guides are added every week, starting with some of the most visited cities in Portugal, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands and beyond.
meta_title: TravelAcross EU – Simple Guides for European Cities & Trips
meta_description: Plan easy trips across Europe with practical guides to countries, cities and routes. Start with Lisbon, Barcelona, Paris, Rome, Amsterdam, Berlin and more.
og_title: TravelAcross EU – Discover Europe with Simple, Realistic Guides
og_description: Browse practical travel guides for European cities, countries and routes. No hype, just clear suggestions that are easy to follow.

title: Countries in Europe You Can Explore with TravelAcross EU
subtitle: Start with a country and then dive into cities, regions and easy routes.
body:
Use this page as your starting map. Pick a country that interests you, then click through to see the main cities we cover first, plus ideas for combining them in one trip.

We are starting with some of the most visited destinations in Portugal, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Germany and a few more. Over time, every EU country will get deeper coverage.
meta_title: European Countries – Travel Guides by Country | TravelAcross EU
meta_description: Browse European travel guides by country. See which cities and regions we cover in Portugal, Spain, France, Italy, the Netherlands, Germany and more.
og_title: Countries in Europe – Start Your Trip by Picking a Country
og_description: Choose a European country and see which cities, regions and routes we suggest there.

title: European Cities with Practical, No-Nonsense Guides
subtitle: From classic capitals to relaxed second cities with fewer crowds.
body:
Our city guides focus on how it actually feels to spend 2–5 days in a place. You will find simple neighborhood suggestions, realistic daily routes and ideas for combining nearby towns in one trip.

We are starting with cities like Lisbon, Porto, Barcelona, Madrid, Paris, Lyon, Nice, Rome, Florence, Venice, Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Brussels, Bruges, Ghent, Berlin, Munich, Hamburg and more.
meta_title: European City Guides – Realistic City Breaks | TravelAcross EU
meta_description: Discover European city guides built around realistic city breaks. Start with Lisbon, Barcelona, Paris, Rome, Amsterdam, Berlin and other major cities.
og_title: European City Guides – Start Planning Your Next City Break
og_description: Find practical guides to major European cities with simple routes, areas to stay and trip ideas.

title: Destinations, Neighborhoods and Areas Worth Your Time
subtitle: Zoom in from city level into specific districts, viewpoints and coastal areas.
body:
Destinations go one level deeper than our city pages. Instead of just telling you to visit a city, we show you which areas, viewpoints and nearby towns are actually worth the time and effort.

Think of riverfront districts, hilltop viewpoints, island day trips, coastal drives and specific neighborhoods that make a trip feel memorable rather than rushed.
meta_title: European Destinations – Neighborhoods, Viewpoints & Day Trips
meta_description: Explore European destinations at a detailed level. See specific neighborhoods, coastal routes, islands and viewpoints around each city.
og_title: Zoom Into the Best Parts of Each European Destination
og_description: Browse detailed destination ideas around major European cities, from neighborhoods to day trip areas.

title: TravelAcross EU Blog
subtitle: Short, honest posts about planning European trips in a calm way.
body:
The blog is where we share short articles about planning routes, choosing where to stay, using trains instead of extra flights and avoiding the most stressful parts of travel.

New posts will cover focused topics like how to split time between Lisbon and Porto, what to combine with Barcelona, and how to chain smaller cities together without burning out.
meta_title: TravelAcross EU Blog – Trip Ideas & Planning Tips
meta_description: Read practical blog posts about planning calm, realistic European trips with clear examples, routes and timing suggestions.
og_description: Browse short articles about planning simple European trips, choosing cities and combining routes.

title: About TravelAcross EU
subtitle: Built for people who like Europe but don’t want to overcomplicate travel.
body:
TravelAcross EU is designed as a calm, realistic alternative to overloaded travel sites. Instead of listing everything, we focus on simple city combinations, clear examples and honest snapshots of each place.

This project also doubles as a live demo of what a travel-focused website can look like for agencies, bloggers and small businesses who want a clean, SEO-friendly base to build on.
meta_title: About TravelAcross EU – Simple European Trip Planning
meta_description: Learn what TravelAcross EU is and who it is for. A simple, realistic guide for planning European trips and a demo for travel websites.
og_description: Find out why TravelAcross EU focuses on simple, realistic European travel planning.

title: Contact & Collaboration
subtitle: Questions about a trip idea or using this as a website demo? Get in touch.
body:
If you have questions about a specific destination, want to suggest a city or are interested in using this setup as the base for your own travel site, you can reach out through the contact form.

We are open to collaboration with local guides, photographers and small travel businesses across Europe.
meta_description: Contact TravelAcross EU with questions about destinations, trip ideas or using this project as a demo for your own travel website.
og_description: Get in touch about trip questions or collaboration opportunities around European travel content.

title: Flights Within Europe Without Losing Your Whole Day
subtitle: How to use flights when they actually help, and avoid them when trains are better.
body:
Flights are sometimes necessary, especially for longer hops across Europe or when time is tight. On this page we focus on when flights make sense, how to compare them with trains and how to avoid wasting half your trip in airports.

Later, this area can connect to partner tools or agencies. For now, it exists to explain the logic behind our suggested routes and when we recommend flying versus using rail.
meta_title: Flights in Europe – When Flying Actually Makes Sense
meta_description: Discover when flights inside Europe are worth it, how to compare routes with trains and how to avoid losing whole days to airport transfers.
og_title: Flights for European Trips – A Calm Approach
og_description: Understand when to fly and when to use trains for your trips across Europe with minimal stress.

title: Where to Stay in Each City Without Overthinking It
subtitle: Simple area suggestions instead of endless hotel lists.
body:
Instead of listing hundreds of hotels, we focus on a few areas and streets where most travelers will be comfortable. Once you know which zone fits you, you can pick any hotel or apartment inside that area.

Later, this page can link to partner booking tools. For now it serves as an explanation of how we think about neighborhoods, walking distances and night-time atmosphere in each city.
meta_title: Where to Stay in European Cities – Simple Area Guides
meta_description: See which areas we recommend in each European city, so you can choose any hotel or apartment inside that zone with confidence.
og_title: Where to Stay – Area-Based Suggestions for European Cities
og_description: Learn our approach to picking neighborhoods and zones instead of chasing hotel reviews for hours.

title: Experiences & Ways to Spend Your Time in Europe
subtitle: Slow walks, viewpoints, food stops and small details that make a trip feel good.
body:
Experiences are where we group ideas that are not tied to one single attraction. Think of city walks, food routes, evening viewpoints, local markets and simple rituals you can repeat in different places.

This section will grow slowly as new cities are added. It is also a good place for local guides or small businesses to plug in with their own experience ideas in the future.
meta_title: European Travel Experiences – Walks, Food & Viewpoints
meta_description: Get ideas for simple experiences across Europe, from city walks and food routes to relaxed viewpoints and everyday rituals.
og_title: Experiences Across Europe – Ideas Beyond Checklists
og_description: Browse experience ideas that focus on how your trip feels, not just how many attractions you check off.
